newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha steadies after Tuesday's sharp hike.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha steadies after Tuesday's sharp hike.

text.p: NWE naphtha was broadly steady on Wednesday after the $3 a tonne hike on Tuesday, dealers said.
The problems at a German refinery over the last few days which saw extra buying of fob material appear to have been resolved.
"They (the refinery) looks to have eased off buying," said one trader.

Russian material continues to act as a brooding presence over the whole market, but prices were steady around $171 a tonne bid on a fob basis and the market was less concerned about quality issues than it has been in the past.
Interest remains for Alexandria parcels and one cargo was sold into Rotterdam yesterday.
Naphtha swaps were unchanged from Tuesday's close with July at $176-177, August about $2.50 stronger and September a further $1.50 stronger.
